metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3753 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A race problem was seen in the vt_k_ioctl in drivers/tty/vt/vt_ioctl.c inthe Linux kernel, which may cause an out of bounds read in vt as the writeaccess to vc_mode is not protected by lock-in vt_ioctl (KDSETMDE). Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-lowlatency - 4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1120-aws - 4.4.0-1120.126
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1126-azure - 4.15.0-1126.139~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1120.126').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1126.139~14.04.1').
